intro: Plectronia xanthotricha, commonly known as the yellow-haired plectronia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, yellowish stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Plectronia xanthotricha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
